snippet: On L.B.J., Robert A. Caro has more to say. And more to say. And more to say. And more to say.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column on the release of author Robert A Caro's The Passage of Power, the fourth volume of a multivolume biography of Lyndon B Johnson; argues that for all its literary weight, Caro's work fails to reconcile the former president's ruthless ambition with the far-reaching and compassionate accomplishments of his administration.
lead_paragraph: On L.B.J., Robert A. Caro has more to say. And more to say. And more to say. And more to say.

headline.seo: The L.B.J. Story Isn’t Over Yet
